title: Detectives Searching for Suspect Who Broke Into Riverdale Park Home
body:
Prince George’s County Police detectives are actively working
to identify and arrest a man who broke into a home in Riverdale Park Tuesday
morning as a family slept inside. 
On August 7, at approximately 6:30 am, officers with the Riverdale
Park Police Department were called to the home in the 5000 block of Jefferson
Street for the report of a breaking and entering. The preliminary investigation
reveals a victim told officers a man broke into her apartment as she and her
two young children slept. The suspect then touched a young girl on her leg and
back. The suspect ran from the apartment after the mother confronted him. The
victims were not hurt. The Prince George’s County Police Department was
notified and immediately opened an investigation. The suspect is described as an African American male,
approximately 5’11”, with a thin build.There are currently no other similar
incidents reported in the Riverdale Park area. Anyone with information
on this case is asked to call the Sexual Assault Unit at .
